subject: Law
title: Renewable Energy Law
description: A quick win: understand Renewable Energy Law.

hook.text: Solar and wind are now cheaper than coal. But building them still faces legal hurdles: permits, land, and grid access.

buildup.text: Renewable energy law governs incentives, siting, grid interconnection, and purchase agreements for clean power.

discovery.text: The IRA (2022) offers massive tax credits for solar, wind, EV, and battery projectsâ€”over $370 billion in incentives.

twist.text: NIMBYism is a major barrier. Communities often support renewables in theory but oppose projects near their homes.

climax.text: Permitting reform is the bottleneck. Even approved projects wait years for transmission lines and permits.

punchline.text: Clean energy is ready. The law is still catching up to deploy it.

quiz.question: What is NIMBYism in renewable energy?
options: Local opposition to projects near one's home
